extension.description: WordPress system plugin. To make use of this plugin you will need to enter the URL segment to your blog into the Blog URL path parameter. For example, if the URL to your blog is http://example.com/blogs/, you will want to enter blogs.

field.name: url_path
field.label: Blog URL paths
field.description: (Separate by a new line return). This is the URL that you use to access your blog. You can add multiple paths if you have many menu items for your blogs. For example if your blog is at this address 'http://www.example.com/blogs/' then type in the word 'blogs' into this text area. If you have another menu link that looks like this 'http://www.example.com/blogs/blogname/' you would enter 'blogs/blogname in a new line.

field.name: request_uri_suffix
field.label: Request URI Suffix
field.description: This is only for sh404SEF users, if you are using a suffix in your URLs, pick it from the list. Your URLs in WordPress will always have a forward slash at the end, this is just dependant on the settings of sh404SEF

field.name: is_homepage
field.label: Is Homepage
field.description: Is the blog setup on the homepage?

field.name: menu_slug
field.label: Menu Slug Name
field.description: The menu slug name setup for the homepage.
